intro: Euphrasia arctica, commonly known as the arctic eyebright, is a small flowering plant native to Arctic and alpine regions. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, yellowish flowers and hairy, succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in cold, moist environments. It is known for its medicinal properties, with traditional uses in treating eye ailments and respiratory conditions. Euphrasia arctica is an important component of the tundra ecosystem, contributing to biodiversity in extreme climates.
